instruction: Current medication: Glipizide (exact dose not specified) taken orally for Type 2 diabetes mellitus; patient notes lower blood-sugar readings but increased appetite and concern about potential weight gain.

attributes.sig: Take orally (dose not specified) for type 2 diabetes mellitus.

instruction: Current medication: Losartan (dose not specified) taken daily for essential hypertension; switched from lisinopril; blood pressure well-controlled, no cough, intermittent ankle swelling reported.
Type 2 diabetes mellitus without complications (ICD-10: E11.9) – improved glycemic control on glipizide; continue monitoring appetite and weight.

attributes.narrative: Glycemic control is better on glipizide; continue medication and monitor appetite and weight.
attributes.background: Improved glycemic control observed while on glipizide; plan is to continue current therapy and monitor appetite and weight.

instruction: Essential (primary) hypertension (ICD-10: I10) – well-controlled on losartan; mild ankle edema observed, will monitor.

attributes.narrative: Hypertension is well-controlled on losartan. Continue current therapy and monitor ankle edema.
attributes.background: Blood pressure remains well-controlled on current losartan regimen; only mild ankle edema noted.

instruction: Patient on glipizide reports increased hunger since initiation but enjoys lower blood-glucose readings; concerned about potential weight gain. Switched from lisinopril to losartan previously, resulting in resolution of cough but now experiencing occasional ankle swelling. Blood pressure otherwise controlled.

attributes.narrative: Patient notes increased hunger since initiating glipizide, appreciates improved blood-sugar readings but is concerned about possible weight gain. After switching from lisinopril to losartan, the prior cough resolved; however, the patient now experiences occasional ankle swelling while blood pressure remains well controlled.

instruction: Advise patient to monitor weight regularly, adhere closely to meal plan, continue checking blood-glucose readings, and report if ankle swelling persists or worsens so medication or diet can be adjusted.

attributes.comment: Advise patient to monitor weight regularly, adhere closely to meal plan, continue checking blood-glucose readings, and report if ankle swelling persists or worsens so medication or diet can be adjusted.
